page.title: 11Birds in the Guyzance area.
page.content: The birds,both resident and migrant,play a major role in the ecology of the area.The arable farming generates quantities of spilt grain which encourages seed eating birds like collared dove and house sparrow.The farm buildings and cottages are nesting sites for barn owls,house martins and swallows.The hedges are the favoured habitat of yellowhammer and linnet in patricular but the chaffinch and greenfinch also choose to nest there.The sparrowhauk with dashing flight seeks prey along the hedgerows while the kestrel may be seen hovering over open country.The carrion crow is ever present and it obtains a quantity of it's food from road casualties.Rooks feed in large flocks in ploughed and stubble fields.Warblers occur in summer, redwing and fieldfare in winter.
